CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged an action against her husband with ORG , seeking a judicial determination of their parental rights and obligations in respect of their child .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered an interim measure in the applicant ’s favour .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave the applicant custody of the child . It did not order the defendant to pay any maintenance . On CARDINAL DATE ORG quashed the judgment in its part concerning maintenance and remitted the case to ORG . The view was expressed that the court of first instance had not sufficiently established the relevant facts . ORG ordered ORG to proceed along the lines specified .

CARDINAL . In a judgment of DATE ORG determined the issue . On DATE ORG again quashed the relevant part of the judgment and remitted the case to ORG . It found that ORG had not sufficiently established the relevant facts and explained to the latter how the case should be dealt with .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant withdrew the action as she had reached an out - of - court settlement with the defendant .
CARDINAL . ORG thus discontinued the proceedings on DATE . The decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , on DATE , ORG found that ORG had violated the applicant ’s right under LAW to a hearing without unjustified delay . ORG established that the case was not complex and that no delays could be imputed to the applicant . It noted that ORG had acted ineffectively . In view of the subject - matter of the proceedings , their overall duration had been excessive . ORG concluded that the finding of a violation represented in itself sufficient just did not order ORG to proceed with the case on the ground that the applicant had withdrawn the action . It ordered ORG to reimburse the applicant ’s legal costs .
